definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: Duanwu Festival is originated in China, and was initially a day to prevent illness.
sentences.chinese: 端午节起源于中国，起初是人们以祛病防疫的节日。

sentences.english: Research on emergency hygiene and epidemic support information.
sentences.chinese: 应急卫生防疫保障信息的研究。

sentences.english: The essay deems that rural sanitation and epidemic prevention shall be solved by public finance security.
sentences.chinese: 本文认为农村卫生防疫应该由公共财政保障解决。

sentences.english: I have a vaccination last week.
Provide health prevention measures for staff such as vaccinations.
sentences.chinese: 为雇员提供预防性医疗保健如注射防疫针。

sentences.english: Thirdly, effectively strengthen health and epidemic prevention work.
sentences.chinese: 三是切实加强卫生防疫工作。

sentences.english: All school-aged children require an Immunization Form.
sentences.chinese: 小童报读加拿大学校时需要一份防疫注射记录。

sentences.english: A corps of doctors arrived to inoculate the recruits.
sentences.chinese: 一队医生来给新兵打防疫针。

sentences.english: Coordinating epidemic prevention station and doing well the prevention vaccination and prevention and controlling of infectious disease.
sentences.chinese: 配合卫生防疫站，做好预防接种和传染病防治。

sentences.english: Why can there be fevered undesirable reaction after cheeper hits inoculation?
sentences.chinese: 为什么幼儿打完防疫针以后会有发烧的不良反应？

sentences.english: It is the responsibility of the epidemic prevention center to promote epidemic prevention measures.
sentences.chinese: 卫生防疫的宣传工作，是防疫站的职责。

sentences.chinese: 卫生防疫的宣传工作，是防疫站的职责。

sentences.english: Article 7 People’s governments at all levels shall strengthen the leadership over animal epidemic prevention.
sentences.chinese: 第七条各级人民政府应当加强对动物防疫工作的领导。
